name: Ambra grisea
Relationship: Do not confound with AMBER - Succinum. q.v. MOSCHUS frequently follows advantageously. Compare: Oleum succinum (hiccough). Sumbul; Castor.; Asaf.; Crocus. Lilium.
Modalities: Worse: music; presence of strangers; from any unusual thing; morning
Better: slow motion in open air; lying on painful part; cold drinks
Common names: Ambergis - A Morbid Secretion of the Whale

Heart: Palpation, with pressure in chest as if from a lump lodged there, or as if chest were obstructed
Palpation in open air with pale face
Head: Slow comprehension
Rush of blood to head, when listening to music
Pressure on front part of head with mental depression
Hearing impaired
Profuse bleeding from teeth
Hair falls out
Vertigo, with weakness in head and stomach
Tearing pain in upper half of brain
Epistaxis, especially in the morning
Senile dizziness
Respiratory: Hollow, spasmodic, barking cough, coming from deep in chest
Tickling in throat, larynx and trachea, chest oppressed, gets out of breath when coughing
Asthmatic breathing with eructation of gas
Nervous spasmodic cough, with hoarseness and eructation, on waking in morning; worse in presence of people
Stomach: Distension of stomach and abdomen after midnight
Urine: Pain in bladder and rectum at the same time
Burning in orifice of urethra and anus
Burning and itching in urethra while urinating
Feeling in urethra as if a few two drops passed out
Urine turbid, even during emission, forming a brown sediment
Mind: Thinking difficult in the morning with old people
Cannot do anything in presence of others
Dread of people, and desire to be alone
Female: Profuse, bluish leucorrhoea; worse at night
Nymphomania, itching of pudendum, with soreness and swelling
Discharge of blood between periods, at every little incident
Skin: Itching and soreness, especially around genitals
Sleep: Coldness of body and twitching of limbs, during sleep
Cannot sleep from worry; must get up
Extremities: Cramps in hands and fingers, worse grasping anything

details: Suitable to excitable, nervous children and thin, nervous patients. Extreme NERVOUS HYPERTENSIVENESS. External numbness of whole body in the morning and weakness. Nervous bilious temperament. Thin, scrawny women. Adapted to hysterical subjects, or those suffering from spinal irritation, with convulsive cough, eructation, etc. Also for patients WEAKENED BY AGE or overwork, who are anaemic and sleepless. Great remedy for the aged, with impairment of all functions, weakness, coldness and NUMBNESS, usually of single parts, fingers, arms, etc. One-sided complaints call for it. MUSIC AGGRAVATES SYMPTOMS. Ebullitions and pulsations after walking in open air. One-sided complaints.
dosage: Second and third potencies; may be repeated with advantage.
